  1. Write a program to insert a new element in a given array

#include <iostream>

using namespace std;

int main()

{

Â  Â  int size; Â  Â 

Â  Â  int element; Â 

Â  Â  int position;

Â  Â  cout << "Enter the number of elements in the array: ";

Â  Â  cin >> size;

Â  Â  // creating a dynamically allocated array as the array needs to expand and using vector isn't an option_

Â  Â  int *array = new int[size];

Â  Â  for (int i = 0; i < size; i++)

Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << "Enter element at position [" << i + 1 << "] ";

Â  Â  Â  Â  cin >> array[i];

Â  Â  }

Â  Â  cout << "Enter the element to be inserted: ";

Â  Â  cin >> element;

Â  Â  cout << "Enter the position to insert the element at (0-based index): ";

Â  Â  cin >> position;

Â  Â  for (int i = size; i > position; i--)

Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  array[i] = array[i - 1];

Â  Â  }

Â  Â  array[position] = element;

Â  Â  size++;

Â  Â  cout << "Modified array: ";

Â  Â  for (int i = 0; i < size; i++)

Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << array[i] << " ";

Â  Â  }

Â  Â  cout << endl;

Â  Â  delete[] array;

Â  Â  return 0;

}
  1. Write a program to delete an element from an array

using namespace std;

const int MAX_SIZE = 100;

Â  int position;

Â  cout << "Enter the number of elements in the array: ";

Â  cout << "Enter the elements of the array: ";

Â  Â  cout << "Enter element at position [" << i + 1 << "] ";

Â  Â  cin >> array[i];

Â  }

Â  cout << "Enter the position of the element to be deleted (0-based index): ";

Â  cin >> position;

Â  for (int i = position; i < size - 1; i++) {

Â  Â  array[i] = array[i + 1];

Â  }

Â  size--;

Â  cout << "Modified array: ";
